item.title: Time Series
item.description: In this post we will make some time series interactive graphics for some of the best players in the MLB history. First we need to load some packages: library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph) Then we need to extract the data we want to use: df<-Batting%>% filter(playerID=='ruthba01')%>% select(yearID,HR) df ## yearID HR ## 1 1914 0 ## 2 1915 4 ## 3 1916 3 ## 4 1917 2 ## 5 1918 11 ## 6 1919 29 ## 7 1920 54 ## 8 1921 59 ## 9 1922 35 ## 10 1923 41 ## 11 1924 46 ## 12 1925 25 ## 13 1926 47 ## 14 1927 60 ## 15 1928 54 ## 16 1929 46 ## 17 1930 49 ## 18 1931 46 ## 19 1932 41 ## 20 1933 34 ## 21 1934 22 ## 22 1935 6 The last step is to create the interactive visualization:

item.title: Bar Plots in RStudio
item.description: In this plot we will create an interactive bar plot with the Lahman database, dplyr, ggiraph, and ggplot2: First let’s load some packages: library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph) Now let’s create a data frame to be able to work with ggplot, and ggiraph later. df<-Teams%>% filter(yearID==1980)%>% select(name,HR)%>% arrange(HR) head(df) ## name HR ## 1 New York Mets 61 ## 2 San Diego Padres 67 ## 3 Houston Astros 75 ## 4 San Francisco Giants 80 ## 5 Cleveland Indians 89 ## 6 Chicago White Sox 91 The column name is a character, and we need to make it a factor (category) in order to be able to put the bar plot in order:
